title: Another Milestone student discharged from hospital after 4 months
body: So far, 35 people, including students and teachers, have been discharged from the hospital Another student who suffered serious injuries in the Bangladesh Air Force fighter jet crash at Milestone School and College in Uttara has been released from the hospital after four months of treatment. The victim is identified as Sheikh Saiyeba Mehzabin, 11, a 4th grader student of the school. Resident Medical Officer of the National Institute of Burn and Plastic Surgery Dr Shawon Bin Rahman, said Mehzabin received 22% injuries and was discharged from the hospital on Wednesday. So far, 35 people, including students and teachers, have been discharged from the hospital. The fatal crash occurred on July 21, shortly after an FT-7 BGI fighter jet took off from the Kurmitola Airbase, sparking a massive blaze that claimed 36 lives and left many injured.
